thread.title: Michelle Dewberry told her mum she wanted to die and reassured her she 'couldn't have done anything'

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Michelle Dewberry told her mum she wanted to die and reassured her she 'couldn't have done anything'
text:
Michelle Dewberry told her mum she wanted to die and reassured her she 'couldn't have done anything' The Apprentice star has opened up about her struggles with her mental health   Share   Comments By Alistair McGeorge 09:04, 21 FEB 2017 TV Michelle Dewberry talks to Helen (Photo: ITV)   Share   Comments Get celebs   Michelle Dewberry has revealed her mum was "heartbroken" after she told her she wanted to commit suicide.
The Apprentice star has opened up about her battle with depression, and candidly spoke to ITV's Lorraine as she explained she told her mum to reassure her that she couldn't have helped.
"I went to my mum purely to tell her," she explained to stand-in host Helen Skelton. "I wanted her to be reassured that she couldn't have done anything... She was heartbroken."
Michelle Dewberry has opened up about her battle with depression (Photo: ITV) She told her mum she was going to kill herself (Photo: ITV) Michelle - who was on the brink before her mum made her seek help - revealed how she didn't think she had a problem. 
"You feel like you're a burden to everyone around you," she added.
Michelle admitted she felt like "a burden" (Photo: ITV) Meanwhile, she is in a much healthier place now - and encouraged people battling the same or similar issues to see "light at the end of the tunnel".
She said: "I've been in a situation where no one could persuade me otherwise... It was in spite of everything. I didn't believe there was a light at the end of the tunnel."
She is in a much better place now (Photo: ITV) However, now the star doesn't "want to die" and said "life's awesome" as she told people to talk about their problems.
"I promise you - life, it is amazing. But you've got to get through that."
